EmailTemplate.subject: How to Assure Microsoft Exchange Performance
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<[[http://turbonomic.com/thx-wp-assuring-microsoft-exchange-performance-e-book-thank-you?utm_source=turbonomic&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ms-exchange&utm_content=09012016]]> Hi {{lead.First Name:default=There}}, Are you running Microsoft Exchange? Did you know that the mail server will experience performance degradation when it’s over-provisioned, as well as under-provisioned? Stop the sizing guessing games. If you want to assure performance in your Microsoft Exchange deployment, you’ll need to look at the problem in a different light. To learn why this matters and what this means for you, download the e-Book below. You Will Learn
- Why the design of Microsoft Exchange specifically requires that it run on virtualized infrastructure that is in a Desired State - How traditional approaches to virtualization and cloud management exacerbate performance issues for Microsoft Exchange - How economic abstractions of the data center achieve and maintain a Desired State in virtual and cloud environments
